lists-operations_key1: What can we do with Lists?
lists-operations_key2: In this exercise, we will try to understand how do we use LISTS. Just as we saw that a list contains a collection of values. So we need to find a way, that how can we access these values.
lists-operations_key3: What happened when we wrote nameslist[1]? Did "shivam" got printed?
lists-operations_key4: Here, [1] is called INDEX. To access any item of a list, we use the INDEX of that item. Let us see what is the index of all the items in the given list.
lists-operations_key5: ["annu", "shivam", "deepa", "pooja", "rupa"]
lists-operations_key6: annu has index 0
lists-operations_key7: shivam has index 1
lists-operations_key8: deepa has index 2
lists-operations_key9: pooja has index 3
lists-operations_key10: rupa has index 4
lists-operations_key11: If you see carefully, then you will notice that the INDEX of that ITEM is one less than its position. The counting of the INDEX starts from 0, not from 1.
lists-operations_key22: Does the last line gives you error ?
lists-operations_key24: Simply means - whatever INDEX you have given, that INDEX is out of range of the given indices of list. (indices - plural of index).
lists-operations_key26: What is the maximum INDEX that we can put?
lists-operations_key28: 1 less than the length of the INDEX. If we will put more value than the range of the index, then index out of range error will come.
lists-operations_key29: Try to google this error and understand about it. This error will not leave you ;), its better that you understand it now only.
lists-operations_key31: In the same way we can update/change the ITEMS in a given LIST.
lists-operations_key32: Did you notice anything? The ITEM present at 0 INDEX has now been changed to "abhishek". Similarly, run this code now.
lists-operations_key33: The ITEM that was present at  INDEX 3 has now changed to "rishabh". Keep in mind that INDEX is 1 less than the position of the item. Similarly, if you write something as given below :
lists-operations_key34: So, you will get a list index out of range error, because at the 5th index no item exists.
lists-operations_key35: Length of List and Adding values of the List
lists-operations_key36: If we want to see the length of the list then we use the len () (length function).
lists-operations_key37: If we want to add one new value to a list then we will use append function. By using the append(), we can add an element at the end of the list.
lists-operations_key38: Here, you can see that previously the list length was 5 but after using the append(), the length of the list became 6. When you printed names_list then the value dhruv was added in the last.
lists-operations_key40: In this way, you can add as many elements as you want.
lists-operations_key42: Just as we can add elements to the list, similarly we can remove elements from the list we can use the pop(). To remove the last element from the list we can use the pop function.
lists-operations_key43: Try to print it and see if the last element is removed or not. Let's try to one more element from the list.
lists-operations_key44: You can use pop function with an argument also on a given list. That means you can also add index to the pop function, which will remove the desired element of the given index from the list.
lists-operations_key46: Check if Element exists in List
lists-operations_key47: We can do a lot of interesting operations on the list. One of the important operations of lists is to check whether a particular element is present in the given ITEM LIST or not.
lists-operations_key49: Its result will come as True because "shivam" element exists in names_list.
lists-operations_key50: Its result will come as False because "imtiyaz" element does not exist in the names_list.
lists-operations_key51: As this is a Boolean value, it will return (True/False), we can also use it with the if statement.
